course5.title: Time and Date
course5.description: Each lesson is a short micro-burst using step1 (introduce), step2 (typing recall), and step3 (listening/comprehension). Days and months are separate lessons; time and date phrases are each their own lesson.

step1.note: loo-neh-DEE; days aren’t capitalized; week starts on Monday.

lesson21.title: What time is it? (Che ore sono?)

step1.english: What time is it? (Che ore sono?)
step1.note: keh OH-reh SO-noh — Alternate way to ask the time (plural hours).

mcq.question: Which phrase means 'What time is it? (Che ore sono?)'?

step2.type_prompt: Che ore s__o?  = What time is it? (Che ore sono?)

step1.note: eh LOON-ah — Use 'È' for 1 o’clock because 'ora' is singular.
SO-noh leh DOO-eh — Use 'Sono le' for all hours except 1 o’clock.
